item.description:
Join us for an 8 to 10 mile relaxed ride that includes a picnic lunch and visits to couple of parks that have great views of the Mass Bay and the Boston skyline. Most of the route is fairly flat with only a few hills. Over half of the the ride will be right along the shore. Plans to stop at “The Tides” restaurant for chowder may be made for the trip home. Check: www.nahant.com for directions and more information on Nahant..

Trip Coordinator: David Goldsmith (dgoldsmith38@aol.com)
Meet: 11AM in front of the Dunkin donuts Snack Shack that is right outside the Nahant Beach Parking Lot and adjacent to “The Tides” restaurant, the parking there is free after the 1st of October. Bring some water, a lunch and your camera. Look for David at the shack with his Mosaic Cap and a sign.
RSVP: Required, email David at the addresses listed above by Sat October 10th. Please include a phone number for contact on the day of the event. Anyone who wants to take the train David can meet at the Swampscott station at 10:00 for 20 minute ride along Lynn beach out to Nahant. Just let David know if you are going to take the train.
No charge for the event, just $5 for a guest or nonpaid member.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a Mosaic cap and waiting at the Dunkin Doughnuts shack next to the restaurant

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Bike Ride around Nahant on Columbus Day
